KLB PSSI: Benhard Limbong Mundur Sebagai Calon Ketua
02 Nov 2019, 02:23 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta- Sejam menjelang Pembukaan Kongres Luar Biasa atau KLB PSSI, salah satu calon ketua umum Benhard Limbong mengundurkan diri. "Saya tidak ikut karena tidak bisa full time di PSSI," kata dia di Hotel Shangrila, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Benhard Limbong mengaku pesimistis mampu meraih suara mayoritas dalam Kongres Luar Biasa di Hotel Shangri-la, 2 November 2019. Mantan Ketua Komisi Disiplin PSSI ini mengaku tradisi lama untuk memiliki ketua umum masih digunakan oleh para pemilik suara.
"Semacam money politic kuliat gitu lo," kata dia menjelaskan dugaan politik uang di KLB PSSI saat dihubungi Tempo, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Awalnya, kata Benhard, voters PSSI yang telah membangun komitmen memberi dukungan dalam kongres sudah lebih dari 10 voters. Ia menyebutkan sebenarnya tidak mau menuduh macam-macam kepada voters yang telah membangun komitmen tapi menjelang KLB digelar jadi sulit dihubungi.
"Ada apa? Kemarin-kemarin yang bersangkutan hubungi terus, tiba-tiba dihubungi nggak bisa lagi," kata dia.
Ia menduga peluangnya menjadi ketua umum PSSI mengecil karena jumlah dukungan yang telah dikumpulkan tergerus sebanyak 50 persen. Walaupun kecil peluangnya mendapatkan suara mayoritas, Benhard mengatakan tetap bakal datang ke KLB karena cinta sama sepak bola dan PSSI.
"Suaranya dikasih ke siapa saya tidak tahu, nggak boleh nuduh," kata dia menjelaskan suaranya yang telah beralih ke calon lainnya.
Di kongres PSSI nanti, total ada 11 calon yang akan memperebutkan kursi ketua umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Mereka adalah Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis. Lalu, La Nyalla Mattalitti, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, dan Yesayas Oktavianus.
IRSYAN HASYIM

PSSI KLB: Benhard Limbong Resigns as Candidate for Chair
02 Nov 2019, 02:23 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - An hour before the opening of the Extraordinary Congress or KLB PSSI, one of the candidates for general chair Benhard Limbong resigned. "I did not participate because I could not be full time at PSSI," he said at the Shangrila Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Benhard Limbong said he was pessimistic that he could win a majority in the Extraordinary Congress at the Shangri-la Hotel, November 2, 2019. The former Chairman of the PSSI Disciplinary Commission claimed that the old tradition of having a general chairperson was still used by the voters.
"It's a kind of money politics," he said, explaining the alleged money politics at the PSSI KLB when contacted by Tempo, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Initially, said Benhard, PSSI voters who had built a commitment to provide support in the congress had more than 10 voters. He said that he actually did not want to accuse all sorts of voters who had built commitments but before the KLB was held it was difficult to contact.
"What's wrong? Yesterday, the person concerned continued to contact, suddenly he could not be contacted anymore," he said.
He suspects that his chances of becoming PSSI's chairman are diminished because the amount of support that has been collected has eroded by as much as 50 percent. Although there is little chance of getting a majority vote, Benhard said he would still come to KLB because of his love for football and PSSI.
"His voice was given to whom I did not know, should not be accused," he said, explaining his voice had turned to other candidates.
In the PSSI congress later, there are a total of 11 candidates who will compete for the chair of the PSSI general chair for the 2019-2023 period. They are Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis. Then, La Nyalla Mattalitti, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, and Yesayas Oktavianus.
